title:
Monte Carlo Study of TeV-Scale String Resonances in Photon-Jet
  Scattering
abstract:
STRINGS is a Monte Carlo (MC) event generator for simulating the production
and decay of first and second string resonances in proton-proton collisions.
STRINGS can also interface with other programs such as Pythia using the Les
Houches Accord to produce more accurate data. In this paper, we validate
STRINGS for the simulation of 2-parton $\rightarrow$ $\gamma$-parton scattering
events by comparing to previous literature. After validation, we produce MC
samples of resonances using $M_s$ = {5.0,5.5,6.0,6.5,7.0} TeV at $\sqrt{s}$ =
{13,13.6} TeV with STRINGS and Pythia and analyze the kinematic data. To
accurately reproduce previous results close to resonance, it is necessary to
introduce a scaling factor of $\approx$ 0.53. With this correction, the
resonance structure is as expected.
